nodes.bodyText:
Remove space before newline and after tab. Single tab should be sufficient:
log.debug("Formatted query does not parse:
	statement: [%s]
	formatted: [%s]", statement, sql);
I'm also thinking we don't need brackets around the statement, since it will be of the form Query{...} produced by ToStringBuilder:
log.debug("Formatted query does not parse:
	statement: %s
	formatted: [%s]", statement, sql);

Remove space before newline and after tab.

i kept it for readability (i know in final output it's not needed, but shouldn't hurt)

Single tab should be sufficient:

at lines are intended with a tab, that's why i used two tabs

I'm also thinking we don't need brackets around the statement,

right

It bugs me from a readability standpoint, since I read it thinking about how the final output looks like. But I understand your point.

at lines are intended with a tab, that's why i used two tabs

Ah, makes sense.

nice, i can do that
note that sql will contain many newlines anyway (same for statement to string), which will affect any fmting we do
(i don't want to reprocess the sql to add indents though)

I now realize that if we include all the information in the exception, we shouldn't log, since that violates the no log-and-throw principal. (i.e. all the info is available in the query failure, just like for any other failure)
